panels.content:
#  Components

***Routing*** - apps should be able to receive traffic from end users

***API*** -  users should be interact with our API via the CLI and Pazmin

***Scheduling*** - apps and tasks should be scheduled and run

***Logging*** - users should be able to read and consume their logs

***Service discovery*** - apps should be able to discover and talk to other apps
panels.title: Overview

panels.content:
# Components

- Cell - a server which runs apps (LRPs) and tasks for users
- LRP - long running process
- RLP - Reverse Log Proxy
- UAA - User accounts & authentication server
panels.title: Jargon

panels.content:
# Routing

See [`indicators.yml`](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/routing-release/blob/release/jobs/gorouter/templates/indicators.yml.erb)

## Route registration receipt %

If route registration messages are not received by gorouter, then users will see 404s.

This can be >100% because of how the metrics are collected from distributed components. In the long run it should be 100%

## Route registration latency

If route registration messages are not broadcast in a timely fashion, then users will see 404s.

# API

## Cloud Controller reliability

If Cloud Controller is unreliable, then our users will have a bad user experience when interacting with the API (CLI and Pazmin).

_(This measure is suboptimal because the metric is generated by CC not by gorouter - timeouts and bad gateways will not get counted)_

## UAA reliability

If UAA is unreliable, then our users will have a bad user experience when logging in (CLI and Pazmin).


_(This measure is suboptimal because the metric is generated by UAA not by gorouter - timeouts and bad gateways will not get counted)_

targets.expr:
1 - (
sum(rate(firehose_value_metric_cc_http_status_5_xx[24h]) or vector(0))
/
(
 sum(rate(firehose_value_metric_cc_http_status_5_xx[24h]) or vector(0)) +
 sum(rate(firehose_value_metric_cc_http_status_4_xx[24h]) or vector(0)) +
 sum(rate(firehose_value_metric_cc_http_status_3_xx[24h]) or vector(0)) +
 sum(rate(firehose_value_metric_cc_http_status_2_xx[24h]) or vector(0))
)
)

 sum(rate(firehose_value_metric_cc_http_status_3_xx[48h]) or vector(0)) +

)
)

1 - (
sum(rate(firehose_value_metric_cc_http_status_5_xx[7d]) or vector(0))
/
(

)

1 - (
sum(rate(firehose_value_metric_cc_http_status_5_xx[30d]) or vector(0))
/

)
)

panels.content:
# Scheduling

When a user has an app (long-running-process or LRP) or runs a task (eg `cf run-task`) this has to be placed on a cell (server which runs apps and tasks). An auction is held to allocate a task or a LRP to a cell.

## Auction reliability %

What % of auctions which are started do not fail. Auctions are important because if an auction cannot be fulfilled, users' tasks and apps cannot run.

# Logging

## RLP egress reliability %

Measures `egress / (dropped + egress)` as a percentage. If this is too unreliable then logs will not get through to consumers.

## Syslog agent egress reliability %

The router and diego-cell instances ship logs to syslog consumers. If the syslog agents are too unreliable then logs will not get through to consumers.

A syslog consumer could be a tenant's logging stack, or a SaaS observability service.

_(This is currently unreliably measured due to shortcomings in the firehose exporter)_

# Service discovery

## Bosh-dns-adapter request time

The time taken for internal DNS requests to complete, if these requests take too long then services which rely on internal networking may experience timeouts.
